content: Thanks @Florian Rabe. Are your logical frameworks sufficiently expressive to encode the normalization algorithm of object-languages without needing to descend to Scala code again? How does that work? Most logical frameworks I've seen can encode the equality judgment of object-languages, or perhaps some small- or big-step operational semantics relation, but I never thought of being able to extract an actual implementation of a normalization algorithm from such an encoding without additional coding.
